Name: Coptic textile
Description: Colourfully dyed wool and linen square panel. An inner square contains floral rosettes and flowers in pots, with coloured birds at the corners, and an outer border has a series of circular panels with alternating lion and hare motifs. One side of the textile is much abraded. This is one of a fine set of Coptic textiles from Akhmim acquired in 1888.
